intro: Gomphrena parviflora, commonly known as the dwarf globe flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular inflorescences that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its small, showy flowers bloom throughout the growing season, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Gomphrena parviflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
